intro: Thalictrum glyphocarpum, commonly known as the mountain meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, this species thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and flies.
